alert.note: Alert for Northwestern Fremont County Above 8500Ft; Western, Central Fremont County Below 8500 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 8:14PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Fremont County through 845 PM MDT... At 814 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Coaldale, or 9 miles north of Hayden Pass Burn Scar. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Texas Creek and Howard. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Northwestern Fremont County Above 8500Ft; Western, Central Fremont County Below 8500 Ft
